text.p: Continental Materials Corp said on Wednesday that an investor group led by James Gidwitz, the company's chairman and chief executive officer, had proposed taking the company private.
It said the group had proposed a cash offer of $21 per share for the company's 1.1 million outstanding shares.
It said 35 percent of the outstanding stock was owned by members of the Gidwitz family.
Continental Materials said the proposal was referred to an independent committee of its board for consideration.
The company's stock closed on Tuesday at 18-3/8.

"There has been little market activity in our stock in recent years," said Gidwitz in a statement. "The objective of the proposal to take the company private is to reduce the cost of being public and provide liquidity to our shareholders."
Continental Materials and its subsidiaries manufacture heating and cooling equipment and produce and distribute a variety of construction materials.
